page.title: 11CONTINUED
page.content: There is a garage which also deals in second and brand new cars, sells spare parts and petrol. In Stanley Common the shops include a chip shop, post office, newsagent, general grocer, the White Post Public House and also the Stanley Club. The houses are situated mainly along the main road and there is a council estate. In the square at the crossroads there is a public house called the Rose and Crown. It sells Bass beer and serves Sunday lunches and also bar snacks. There is also a garage, which sells cars and fuel. Included is an old school made into a house. There are two daily bus services to Derby & Ilkeston. One woman interviewed said that she liked living in Stanley Common, it was pleasant but a chemists and other shops were needed, and a zebra crossing.
